title: duplicate repos showing in following section (or having more next repos) when toggling view states

milestone.title: Milestone 1: MVP
milestone.description: This will establish the basic MVP - 1.0.0 release of the application.

body:
Preconditions:
- Either have a following section with more next repos
- Or have any section with more next repos
- personal repos has less than 30 repos

In this case, it is a following section with more next repos

Steps
1. Load following repos view 
2. Load personal repos view 
3. Load following repos view

Expected: Only the original 30 repos should show
Actual: The original 30 repos are duplicated

title: As a user I should be able to see the organization / user owned by a repo
body: This would help add distinction between upstream and forks.  It could simply be prefixing the repo name with the organization, eg. _some-organization/this-repo_

title: As a user the current row for a repository should be highlighted when I am assigned as a reviewer of an issue
address all outstanding TODO comments

body:
TODO list
1. Ideally, all instances of any should be replaced with a type, within reason.
1. Make sure all members, functions (return, args) etc have a type definition
1. Refactor reducer code duplication (similar constructs for mapping issues, generating boilerplate repo objects, etc)
1. Move issue mapping index / offset logic from the container components to the api / store
1. _hasMoreRepos_ vs _nextReposUrl_

should be done after #19
